title: Thin Ice
summaries: Thin Ice is a type of block found in the Snow and Ice biomes. It is found naturally in two configurations: either a single layer over a pool of water, or in large packed regions underground.

Similar to <linked>Ice Blocks</linked>, Thin Ice has reduced friction, and players will slide across it. Thin Ice will break if a player falls on it at a certain speed, usually achieved by falling normally onto it. Landing on Thin Ice will not cause <linked>fall damage</linked> itself, but it will not slow the player's fall on contact, and fall damage will continue to accumulate until the player lands on another block type (unlike <linked>Cobwebs</linked>, for instance, which reset fall damage). <linked>Ice Skates</linked> or any of the combined <linked>accessories</linked> that use them as an ingredient can be used to land on Thin Ice without breaking it and dropping through (also potentially taking fall damage, however).

Thin Ice is destroyed permanently when broken, dropping nothing. On the <linked>[img:Old-gen console version]</linked><linked> Old-gen console version</linked> and <linked>Nintendo 3DS</linked><linked>[img:Nintendo 3DS version]</linked><linked> version</linked>, Thin Ice cannot be picked up, crafted, or moved in any way.
